results.firPara: Eight-two down on aggregate, 12 minutes more to play, thousands of disgruntled fans streaming from the Emirates Stadium. For the first time, Im among them.
results.secPara: Highbury didnt die for this. Its a phrase that became almost a mantra for Alan Daviess popular podcast – The Tuesday Club – that ended last season, a group of lifelong fans left with nothing new to say about a club determined to bring fresh meaning to the phrase stuck in a rut. It wasnt always like this.
results.webTitle: From Highbury to new lows: an Arsenal fan laments missed chances | Toby Moses

results.firPara: Barcelona completed one of the greatest comebacks in football history as Paris Saint-Germain choked on an incredible night at Camp Nou
results.secPara: Hats off to Sid Lowe, who has miraculously kept it together in the most difficult circumstances imaginable for a football match reporter to send across this on-the-whistle report. Astonishing work on an astonishing night at Camp Nou.
results.webTitle: Barcelona 6-1 PSG (Agg: 6-5): Champions League last 16, second leg – as it happened

results.firPara: While Sergio Agüero completed his transformation from substitute to captain, Manchester City underwent an unexpected change themselves. They went from prolific to impotent, losing their lustre and missing the chance to go second as a four-match winning run in the Premier League came to an end.
results.secPara: Agüero led Manchester City for the first time under Pep Guardiola, seemingly symbolising his restoration to prominence, but his scoring sequence stopped. City had struck five times in each of their two previous home games but after the drama of recent weeks at the Etihad Stadium came a dullness that suited leaders Chelsea, their rivals for Champions League places and Stoke, who belied their wretched record against the elite with a display of defiance.
results.webTitle: Pep Guardiola and Manchester City are left frustrated against Stoke City

results.firPara: Manchester Citys title hopes are even slimmer after a dull draw, Stoke thoroughly deserving their point.
results.secPara: Manchester Citys title hopes are even slimmer after a dull draw, Stoke thoroughly deserving their point.
results.webTitle: Manchester City 0-0 Stoke City: Premier League – as it happened

results.firPara: Chelsea are close to agreeing a new contract with Antonio Conte, killing off Internazionales lingering hopes of prising the Italian manager away from Stamford Bridge in the process, but may opt to announce the deal only once the destiny of the title has become clear.
results.secPara: Victory at West Ham on Monday maintained Chelseas imposing advantage at the top of the division, with the leaders having dropped only 15 points this season. The positive impression Conte has made over his first eight months in charge has pleasantly surprised even the clubs own hierarchy and the team could still achieve the second league and FA Cup Double in Chelseas history.
results.webTitle: Antonio Conte and Chelsea set to agree new contract beyond 2019

results.firPara: This week our resident cartoonist imagines how expansion clubs could attract new employees if they were to make embarrassing recruitment ads
results.webTitle: David Squires on ... the world game changers: a recruitment advert for new A-League clubs

results.firPara: When they start feeling sorry for you thats when you really need to worry. Towards the end of Arsène Wengers press conference after Arsenal had been swatted and ragged around the Emirates Stadium like a half-dead bird being toyed with by an indolent cat, there was a strange period where Wenger became unusually angry and incoherent.
results.secPara: Mention was made of the scandalous refereeing decisions Arsenals manager seemed to genuinely believe were responsible for that supine 10-2 aggregate defeat by Bayern Munich. Now and then his voice clogged a little with anger, or fatigue, but he still seemed to be talking mainly to himself.
results.webTitle: Imagine the effects of letting Diego Simeone loose in Arsenal’s dressing room | Barney Ronay

results.firPara: The Brazilian team Cruzeiro will wear specially commissioned squad numbers with messages to highlight daily challenges faced by women in the South American country for their Brazilian Cup match against Murici-AL on 8 March to mark International Womens Day.
results.secPara: The shirts, which will feature a different message for each number such as a rape every 11 minutes or salaries 30% lower, has been organised in conjunction with the NGO AzMina, which fights for female empowerment in Brazil. Announcing the initiative on their website on Wednesday, the Belo Horizonte-based clubs president Gilvan de Pinho Tavares said it was the latest effort to highlight some of the injustices in Brazilian society having previously supported similar campaigns.
results.webTitle: ‘A rape every 11 minutes’: Cruzeiro to wear shirts to mark International Women’s Day

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Big Cup part two, Chapecoense and the blue eyes of Stan Bowles
results.secPara: In todays Fiver Big Cup part two, Chapecoense and the blue eyes of Stan Bowles
results.webTitle: We ain’t got nuttin’ else goin’ on | The Fiver

results.firPara: Bournemouth have reacted furiously to the news that Tyrone Mings has been given a five-match ban after being found guilty of violent conduct following an incident involving Zlatan Ibrahimovic during Saturdays tempestuous 1-1 draw at Old Trafford.
results.secPara: Mings left boot landed on the back of Ibrahimovics head while the Manchester United striker was on the floor in an incident that was not seen at the time by Kevin Friend, the referee, and which prompted the Football Association to charge the 23-year-old and argue that the standard three-match ban was clearly insufficient.
results.webTitle: Anger at Bournemouth as Tyrone Mings gets five-match ban for violent conduct
